divs: Sighting DetailsAt about 6:23 pm I,and a friend was looking toward the south at Venus, Jupiter and Orion, enjoying the view. I noticed what I thought was a dim satellite about 1 degree above Saiph in Orions foot. I pointed this out to my friend. The object was moving like any other satellite. It appeared to be moving from the Southeast toward the northwest and traveled about 1 degree before it faded out. This object was very dim, about magnitude 4 or so, although it may have been brighter but for the almost full moon. Then the object faded from view. Immediately, as this object faded, another starlike object about magnitude -2 or so appeared below Saiph. I told my friend that the object we were seeing did not belong there. It was brighter than Sirius. It did not move. As I watched in disbelief, another smaller object appeared (again about magnitude 4 or so) about a half degree away from the bright object and moved slowly away, toward the northeast. The objects then both faded away together. As an amateur astronomer, I know the sky with some detail. What I saw was not a star, planet,airplane, helicopter, or satellite. I am reporting this in the hope that others also witnessed this event. Thanks,
trends: There have been 22 other sightings in Olympia
There were no other sightings in Olympia on or around February 6th 2012
Summary: observed starlike object about 2 degrees below Saiph in Orion. Object did not move but two much smaller objects were associated with the main object. Main object was as bright as Jupiter.
